body: Damn, I'm getting low on my Mimane Fap Reserves

A man who has improved his art from humble beginnings to master tier niveau. Yoshikazu Hamada may your career continue gloriously. If you wanna  see him draw, just follow his f2c account, his drawing skills are awesome and interesting: http://live.fc2.com/17356889

I think the story actually improved as the ecchi was becoming more extreme peaking at the end of the Mayoiga arc and the Kanaka backstory, I only read it until the end of the very next arc, that one in the temple, but it was still good then but I have heard the most recent arc has been worse; I think both characteristics are not completely related the story peaked and then declined by its own indepently of the hardcore fanservice maybe it was a crutch used by the author to compensate the decline of the plot and not the cause of it.
hagane646 I am  totally agree with you I like the manga I like fanservice but too much is no

I'm both sad and happy to find this. Tsugumomo was actually a great manga until it got plagued with fanservice. The fanservice was always there but it wasn't as heavy and frequent as it is now. The story is still good, though, but still
